projects.name: LostPulse
projects.subtitle: 2D Roguelite
projects.role: Game Designer • Systems / Technical Design (UE5 C++)
projects.overview: LostPulse is a 2D roguelite built around progression depth: upgrades, build choices, and relic synergy. You play as an adventurer entering a devastated world to explore it — and ultimately save its people.
responsibilities: Designed the progression layer: upgrades, shop decisions, and build direction.
Designed skill trees (active + passive) with readable choices.
Designed relic categories (offensive/defensive) and synergy rules.
Focused on scalable systems and future-proof tuning.
challenges: Keeping combat readable at high tempo while preserving player agency.
Balancing responsiveness with fair enemy hit windows.
solutions: Attack phases (startup/active/recovery) with debug visualization for fast iteration.
Consistent timing rules + data-driven tuning fields per attack type.
results: Stable baseline prototype with extensible components to scale into more enemies, weapons, and relics.

timeline.label: Next
timeline.detail: Advanced combat, enemy behaviors, and build/loot tuning

projects.cardDescription: 2D roguelite with shop, upgrades, active/passive skill tree, and offensive/defensive relics — set in a ruined world you explore and try to save.

projects.name: Think Twice
projects.subtitle: 2D Trap / Puzzle Escape
projects.overview: You play as a soul trapped inside a cursed mansion. Your goal is to escape and return to life — but the mansion is full of deadly traps that punish mistakes.
responsibilities: Designed trap pacing and readability: surprise, then learnable mastery.
Built a fail → learn → improve loop with clear feedback.
Tuned difficulty ramp and checkpoint/learning flow.
challenges: Ensuring players understand cause→effect without over-explaining.
Preventing early churn in the first minutes.
solutions: Early puzzles tuned for confidence, then controlled complexity ramp.
results: A concise loop that supports expansion into multiple puzzle sets.

timeline.label: Next
timeline.detail: More levels, difficulty curves, and polish

projects.cardDescription: 2D trap/puzzle escape. You’re a soul trapped in a cursed mansion — learn from failures and survive sudden traps to escape.

projects.name: DeadlyCuriosity
projects.subtitle: 3D Mystery / Escape Room
projects.overview: DeadlyCuriosity is a 3D puzzle mystery where you play as a journalist kidnapped into a house. Your mission is simple: escape — or you remain trapped until you die.
responsibilities: Designed escape-room puzzle structure: observation → inference → execution.
Kept objectives clear without spoiling solutions.
Focused on tension, environment-driven clues, and pacing.
challenges: Keeping guidance helpful without spoiling puzzle discovery.
Maintaining visual readability in dark scenes.
solutions: Room-scoped objectives + progressive disclosure of hints.
UI contrast + tuned lighting rules per environment.
results: A guidance system that scales with content and keeps players oriented.

timeline.label: Next
timeline.detail: More rooms, puzzles, and polish pass

projects.cardDescription: 3D mystery / escape-room. You’re a journalist kidnapped into a house — solve puzzles and escape before it’s too late.

projects.name: Impulse Rogue
projects.subtitle: UE5 • 3D Souls-like
projects.role: Game Designer • Level Designer • Systems Designer
projects.overview: Impulse Rogue is a 3D souls-like currently in active development. The focus is on challenging combat, readable builds, and meaningful equipment choices.
responsibilities: Built the core stats & attributes system (foundations, dependencies, and formulas).
Designed scaling curves and balance tuning across progression.
Owned numbers design: parameters, modifiers, and overall combat math.
Level design / greyboxing: layout planning, interactive placements, and encounter pacing.
Planned enemy distribution and weapon ownership: where enemies appear, which weapon types they use, and why.
challenges: Aligning multiple disciplines on scope and priorities.
solutions: Clear feature definitions + acceptance criteria per sprint.
results: A cohesive production pipeline and a playable vertical slice trajectory.
projects.cardDescription: 3D souls-like in development. I own level greyboxing/layout plus the full stats/attributes framework, scaling curves, and enemy/weapon distribution.
